meanings.definition: Designed to be useful or practical rather than attractive.
meanings.sent1: The simple, utilitarian design of the tool made it easy to use.
meanings.sent2: The utilitarian backpack had many pockets for storing different items.
meanings.sent3: She joked that her utilitarian shoes were so plain, they could double as bricks.
meanings.sent4: The utilitarian approach to cooking focused on efficiency over presentation.
meanings.sent5: The utilitarian nature of the car made it perfect for everyday errands.

meanings.definition: A person who believes that the value of an action should be judged by its usefulness.
meanings.sent1: The utilitarian always considered the practical benefits of each decision.
meanings.sent2: As a utilitarian, he focused on maximizing the overall good for the community.
meanings.sent3: The utilitarian at the party suggested using paper plates to save time on dishes.
meanings.sent4: She was known as the utilitarian of the group, always looking for the most efficient solution.
meanings.sent5: The utilitarian's philosophy was to prioritize functionality over aesthetics.
